title: How to Make Serbian Cevap

steps.headline: Put your meat in a large bowl.
Add fine chopped onion, salt, pepper and spices to the taste!
Add just a drizzle of soy sauce (+-1 tablespoon).
Add some flour so the mixture becomes sticky to the touch.
steps.description: DON'T put more than 4 tablespoons (59.1 ml) of flour in the mix!

steps.headline: Put on some rubber gloves and lubricate them with oil.
Proceed to roll the meat in the shape of a thin sausage (the length is approximately the WIDTH of your hand ) so the overall length of the cevap sausage would be between 10 and 15 cm.
steps.description: The width is between 1,5 and 3 cm.

steps.headline: Roll all the meat in this shape.
Grill the cevap sausages!
steps.description: Turn repeatedly so they won't burn. Ground meat does not need too much time to cook well on the inside. The onion in the mix will unleash a battery upon your taste buds. Break out the Japanese soy sauce and dip the cevap in there before munching them. Enjoy!

text: Put your meat in a large bowl.  Add fine chopped onion, salt, pepper and spices to the taste!  Add just a drizzle of soy sauce (+-1 tablespoon).  Mix the meat.  Add some flour so the mixture becomes sticky to the touch. DON'T put more than 4 tablespoons (59.1 ml) of flour in the mix! Put on some rubber gloves and lubricate them with oil.  Proceed to roll the meat in the shape of a thin sausage (the length is approximately the WIDTH of your hand ) so the overall length of the cevap sausage would be between 10 and 15 cm. The width is between 1,5 and 3 cm. Roll all the meat in this shape.  Grill the cevap sausages! Turn repeatedly so they won't burn. Ground meat does not need too much time to cook well on the inside. The onion in the mix will unleash a battery upon your taste buds. Break out the Japanese soy sauce and dip the cevap in there before munching them. Enjoy! Finished.
